intro: Millotia greevesii subsp. greevesii, commonly known as the greenleaf millotia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
